snp5.10:0.1_0: Book, the arrow springs from the underworld.
snp5.10:1.1_0: “One who dwells in the pleasures of the senses,
snp5.10:1.3_0: who has no craving at all,
snp5.10:1.4_0: and who have crossed over the far shore,
snp5.10:1.5_0: as trembling in the liberation of their heart.”
snp5.10:2.1_0: “One who dwells in the pleasures of the senses,
snp5.10:2.3_0: who has no craving at all,
snp5.10:2.4_0: and who have crossed over the far shore,
snp5.10:3.2_0: Soṇa and immersion are all its profit,
snp5.10:3.3_0: Let me understand identity as a sage,
snp5.10:3.4_0: Since I’ve fallen into my eyes.”
snp5.10:4.2_0: as well as wisdom and grain,
snp5.10:4.3_0: That’s how the sage gave birth,
snp5.10:4.4_0: Where there is nothing and no ownership;
snp5.10:4.5_0: and the ninth of which they question me in Toduce.
